info.title: CNAP API
info.description:
Public API for managing CNAP workspaces, clusters, templates, products, and deployments.

Authenticate with a Personal Access Token via the `Authorization: Bearer cnap_pat_...` header.

Workspace-scoped endpoints require the `X-Workspace-Id` header.

BearerAuth.description: Personal Access Token (cnap_pat_...) or OAuth2 JWT. Create tokens at https://dash.cnap.tech/settings/tokens

suggestion.example: Run `cnap clusters list` to see available clusters

token.description: The full token. This is shown only once — store it securely.

get.description: Returns metadata for all tokens. Full token values are never shown after creation.

post.description: Creates a new PAT. The full token is returned in the response and never shown again.

expiresInDays.description: Token expiry in days. Omit for no expiry.

201.description: Token created. The `token` field is shown only once.

get.description: Lists all workspaces the authenticated user belongs to. No X-Workspace-Id needed.

403.description: Not a member of this workspace

get.description: Lists all clusters in the workspace specified by the X-Workspace-Id header.
Returns detailed information about a cluster, including KaaS status if applicable.

403.description: Not a member of the cluster workspace

patch.description: Update cluster name or region. The region must be in the same workspace.

403.description: Not a member of the cluster workspace

delete.description: Deletes a cluster and its ArgoCD configuration. KaaS-managed clusters are deprovisioned. Fails if the cluster has active installations.

403.description: Not a member of the cluster workspace

get.description: Returns template with its helm sources.

delete.description: Fails if referenced by products or installs.

409.description: Template is referenced by products or installs

post.description: Creates a product with helm sources and cluster associations. Triggers async chart generation.

delete.description: Fails if the product has active installs.
Triggers async deletion workflow that removes the ArgoCD application and install record.

get.description: Returns pods and their containers for the ArgoCD application.
Streams logs from the install pods via Server-Sent Events. Use the `Accept: text/event-stream` header.

schema.description: Only return logs newer than this many seconds

parameters.description: Only return logs newer than this many seconds
parameters.name: sinceSeconds
